result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A. Martine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1&2 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine(on count 1 only) and costs(on both counts) to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Bond of $1000.00 applied to fine and costs.
Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant received credit for 4 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha A. Martine

defendant.name: Martine, Samantha A.
defendant.address: 200 E. Krych St. #7 PO Box 22, Thorp, WI 54771

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant, Samantha A. Martine appeared, pro se, matter resolved  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Pre-trial conference on February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on March 20, 2014 at 10:10 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 10:10 am.
